title: Drawing, "Semi-circular Council Chamber Dedicated to Nature with Alternate Suggestions", 1795–97
medium: Pen and gray ink, graphite, gray, rose wash
inscribed: Base of the statue inscribed:  "ELLE EST LA SOURCE/DE TOUS LES BIENS".  Other inscriptions on the ornamentation read: "LIBERTE", "UNION", "VALEUR", "JUSTICE", "ENERGIE", "ABONDANCE", "PRUDENCE", "MUTIUS SCEVOLA", "JUNIUS BRUTUS", "FABRICIUS".  Further inscriptions at top read (where decipherable): "Les peuple Francais", "Revolution Francaise", "Les peuple Francais".
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Statue of Nature stands behind a burning brazier.  Behind, a niche simulating the interior of a tent, with an oculus in the center of the roof.  Below, seats arranged in five rows in amphitheatrical form.  Various inscriptions on base of statue and on ornamentation.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Semi-circular Council Chamber Dedicated to Nature with Alternate Suggestions", 1795–97.
1795–97. Pen and gray ink, graphite, gray, rose wash. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-462.
